text: -- the complaints in this case were filed in the United States District Court at Little Rock, Arkansas.
If the Court, please.
I should think he -- never mind.
Our position is that the language is in the statute by using the words “United States”.
You mean -- I don't follow that.
Yes.
Well, then it doesn't add enough because it doesn't take corporation.
Before discussing the 1918 Amendment, I would like to emphasize just a few things.
Mr. Doub, what's -- what's the relation of this Corporation to the Department of Agriculture, is it the fact that the constituent of the department --
Well, it has no -- officers or employees independent of those of the Department of Agriculture.
On the department's budget?
On the department's budget.
Who were the policy makers for the corporation?
The policy maker -- makers -- maker rather is the Secretary of Agriculture.
Who actually -- who actually authorizes the loans or the advances?
Well, I would say that first, you have the Secretary making an announcement of the price of which he is going to boycott for example.
Who determines -- who determines, whether he will purchase, he?
He -- of course Congress sets the policy and he implements the policy.

Yes, but -- well, are you suggesting that the word “department” would include all its constituent units and that this is sufficiently a constituent of the Department of Agriculture that comes within the 1878 description of a department?
Well, as I said yesterday, our first contention would be, a much broader one that the False Claims Act should be applied to all wholly owned Government corporations (Voice Overlap).
Now, all of these wholly owned corporations are not similarly identified --
No.
-- nor they're given the parts, are they?
No.
Is the (Inaudible) wholly owned --
Well, that's -- that has a -- a very different status there.
Thank you, Your Honor.
Our concern is merely by stating that the letter still kill it and the story still give its light.
